{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Remove Weeds from Cracks","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Weeds are invasive plants that can overrun your desirable plants and cause damage to housing and yard materials. While some weeds are fairly easy to kill, they can be a bit tricky to remove when they sprout up through the cracks in your driveway, walkways, porch, or pavers. To kill the weeds growing in these cracks, you can use a variety of different home remedies or purchase a commercially-available weed killing liquid or device. You can also remove weeds from cracks by digging up the plants and their roots before sealing the cracks with concrete or gravel. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Killing Weeds with Home Remedies\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Killing-Weeds-with-Home-Remedies\">Killing Weeds with Home Remedies</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Pour boiling water over the cracks to kill weeds safely. Bring a large pot of water to a boil on the stove. Then, carefully pour the boiling water over the leaves and stems of the weeds, as well as in the cracks surrounding the base of the plants.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-1.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The heat from the water will cause the plants to start to wilt immediately, and will kill the roots over the following days or weeks.</li> \n    <li>Boiling water is a great option because it easily gets into the cracks and doesn’t leave harmful residue in the soil.</li> \n    <li>This method is generally most effective on young weeds.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Spray a salt and dish soap solution on the weeds to kill them. Dissolve 1 part table salt or rock salt to 8 parts of hot water. Then, stir in a quarter-sized squirt of dish soap and pour the solution into a spray bottle. Spray the solution over the weeds carefully and try to avoid getting any on nearby soil, plants, or pavement to prevent damage.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-2.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Repeat this process every few weeks as needed until the weeds have died and stopped sprouting.</li> \n    <li>The salt and dish soap solution can discolor and erode cement and kill the surrounding plants.</li> \n    <li>For a quick and easy option, sprinkle rock salt or table salt on the weeds to kill them. This is less effective for stubborn weeds, though.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use white vinegar to kill the weeds growing in cracks. Pour white vinegar into a spray bottle and douse the weeds with it. You can also simply pour the vinegar directly from the bottle onto the weeds.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-3.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Most regular white vinegar is about 5% acetic acid and will get the job done. However, for stubborn weeds, you may need to get horticultural vinegar that's 20% acetic acid. Horticultural vinegar is available at most gardening stores.</li> \n    <li>Adding a quarter-sized squirt of dish soap to the vinegar may make it more effective.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Apply a Borax solution to remove unwanted weeds from cracks. Mix of Borax with of water in a large bowl. Then, apply the solution directly to the unwanted weeds and into the cracks around the weeds. You can use a spray bottle to apply the solution or pour it directly onto the plants from the bowl.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-4.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Borax can irritate your skin, so you may want to wear gloves when handling the solution.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Sprinkle baking soda into the cracks for a natural way to kill the weeds. Sprinkle as much baking soda as you need to cover the tops of the weeds. If you spilled any baking soda around the cracks, use your hands or a brush to sweep it into the cracks so that none is wasted. Repeat this process every 4 to 6 weeks until the weeds are gone.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-5.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Apply baking soda in the spring and fall to new, young weeds for the best results.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Using Commercial Weed Killers\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-Commercial-Weed-Killers\">Using Commercial Weed Killers</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Pour a liquid chemical weed killer over the weeds to remove them. Purchase an all-purpose weed killer, or choose one specifically formulated for the type of weeds that you're dealing with. Follow the instructions on the label to apply the liquid over the weeds. For easier application, you can dilute some concentrated herbicides with water in a spray bottle. Check the instructions to see how to dilute the liquid and how much to spray on the weeds.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-6.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the weed killer you’re using contains chemicals that are harmful to humans, wear protective glasses, long-sleeves, and gloves to protect your skin and eyes from exposure.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>It takes about 2 weeks for commercial liquid weed killers to kill off the weeds.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Torch weeds with a flame-weeder to get rid of them immediately. Follow the instructions for your specific device to turn on the flame-weeder and let it heat up. Then, pass the torch flame over the weeds in the cracks briefly to damage the cell structure of the weeds without actually catching them on fire. Don’t allow the flames to touch the tops of the weeds.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-7.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You may need to apply heat to the area a few times to ensure that the roots are dead and won’t re-sprout.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Flame-weeders are available online and at many garden supply stores. You can also use an ordinary propane torch.</li> \n    <li>Avoid using a flame-weeder near flammable materials like wooden decking or dry grass.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Apply heat directly on the weeds to kill them with a weed steamer. Add water to the steamer and turn it on so the water starts to heat up. Then, hold the steamer over the weeds and press down the designated button for about 5 seconds to release the steam onto the weeds. Repeat this process over all the weeds you want to remove.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-8.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Operating instructions may vary, so make sure you read them carefully before using your weed steamer.</li> \n    <li>The leaves will start to wilt and die immediately, but it generally takes 1-2 days for the entire plant to die.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>You can also use a home steam-cleaning machine in the same manner.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Digging up Weeds and Sealing the Cracks\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Digging-up-Weeds-and-Sealing-the-Cracks\">Digging up Weeds and Sealing the Cracks</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Scoop the weeds and roots out of the cracks with a stake. Using a garden stake, screwdriver, or similarly shaped object, dig up under the weeds and scrape inside the cracks until all the weeds and their roots have been removed. Repeat this process in all the cracks until all of them are clear and only the dirt remains.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-9.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It may be helpful to spray the cracks with a hose or pressure washer to loosen the dirt and make the weeds easier to scrape out.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use a pressure washer to remove the dirt and any lingering roots. Once all the weeds are removed, spray the cracks directly with a pressure washer. This will help lift out any dirt remaining in the cracks, as well as any weed roots that you weren’t able to reach.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-10.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Insert a foam caulking backer rod to fill the gaps or cracks. Measure the length of gaps or cracks in the cement where you removed the weeds. Using a box cutter or knife, cut the foam caulking backer rod to fit the length of the cracks. Then, place the foam into the cracks and press it down until it’s wedged securely inside.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-11.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Foam caulking backer rods are bendable and come in a variety of sizes at most home improvement stores, so you should be able to find a size that will fit in the cement cracks.</li> \n    <li>Some large gaps in concrete are left on purpose to allow the concrete to expand and contract as needed to prevent cracking. The foam allows the concrete to continue to contract while filling the gap to prevent weeds from growing.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Apply roofing cement in the cracks to seal them and prevent regrowth. Remove the cap on the end of the roofing cement nozzle. Place the bottle into an epoxy or roofing cement dispenser. Place the nozzle into the crack in the cement and press down on the dispenser handle to start dispensing the cement into the cracks. Follow the cracks with the nozzle to line them with roofing cement and fill them in.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-12.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also use epoxy or blacktop filler instead of roofing cement to seal the cracks. However, blacktop filler may not be as durable in the long run as roofing cement or epoxy.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Let the cement or epoxy dry for 72 hours before driving or walking on it. To allow the roofing cement or epoxy to dry completely, avoid walking or driving over it for at least 72 hours.<sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup> Drying times may vary depending on the specific product you’re using, however, so check the label to make sure.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f4/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-13.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The roofing cement or epoxy will likely dry on the surface within 24 hours, but may take 72 hours to completely cure.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill the cracks with sand or gravel for a less permanent solution. If you want to prevent the weeds from growing back but you don’t want to permanently fill them with roofing cement or epoxy, try packing the gaps with sand or gravel.<sup id=\"_ref-23\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_note-23\">[23]</a></sup> Pour the sand or gravel into the cracks, pressing it down until it’s tightly packed. Repeat this process until all the cracks or gaps are filled.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Remove Weeds from Cracks Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-14.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Because sand and gravel can come loose over time, you may need to repack the gaps and cracks periodically to keep them filled.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Always wear protective gloves and eyewear when you’re handling harsh chemicals.</li> \n  <li>Keep both flame-weeders and weed steamers away from flammable materials. In addition, avoid coming into contact with the flame or steam, as both of these can severely burn your skin.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span href=\"https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/home/gardening/advice/g777/homemade-weed-killers/?slide=7\">https://www.goodhousekeeping.com/home/gardening/advice/g777/homemade-weed-killers/?slide=7</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_ref-7\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.co.summit.co.us/585/Safety-Spraying-Procedures\">http://www.co.summit.co.us/585/Safety-Spraying-Procedures</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.uvm.edu/vtvegandberry/factsheets/flameweeding.html\">https://www.uvm.edu/vtvegandberry/factsheets/flameweeding.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/YJrA59A7G2I?t=9\">https://youtu.be/YJrA59A7G2I?t=9</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://youtu.be/rwiojxoc55Y?t=8\">https://youtu.be/rwiojxoc55Y?t=8</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://youtu.be/U3fLCT75Gso?t=53\">https://youtu.be/U3fLCT75Gso?t=53</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://youtu.be/U3fLCT75Gso?t=65\">https://youtu.be/U3fLCT75Gso?t=65</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://youtu.be/-0yL-rzB8W4?t=82\">https://youtu.be/-0yL-rzB8W4?t=82</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-20\"><a target=\"_blank\" \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 21 Oct 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-1.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"c033cd4afb6670e15a0dd797b2694c70","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn40@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-53-38-417_49e576acf422070a.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":64933,"destBytes":45272,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-1.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn40@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-53-38-417_49e576acf422070a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/57/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-2.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn3@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-20-973_f107c68eda8cf602.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-3.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn64@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-19-274_80b871ab0cd831ae.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-4.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn20@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-20-314_436d4661de6f9286.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/14/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-5.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn25@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-20-486_e891f1403550526e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-6.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn88@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-19-442_5887abafc4996545.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/56/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-7.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn87@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-15-893_a4a76e428ccabeb0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-8.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn19@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-15-984_cd201a4949d81280.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2b/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-9.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn38@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-20-463_809313599a92d48f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-10.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn57@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-19-782_4cff2b0dd87d1765.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-11.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-11.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-12.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn49@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-16-612_5b035c6fa4f52120.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f4/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-13.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn42@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-18-229_5be54069e75e53b6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-14.jpg/aid11706548-v4-728px-Remove-Weeds-from-Cracks-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn89@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-17-114_3f9f226c13f2c535.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817618067},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Identify a Chow Chow","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>A non-sporting breed from ancient China, the Chow Chow is possibly one of the world's oldest dog breeds.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> Chow Chows, or Chows for short, have several distinctive physical traits and a unique temperament that make them stand out.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup> By being aware of these key traits, you can get a better idea of whether a dog is a Chow Chow. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Identify-a-Chow-Chow&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Identify-a-Chow-Chow&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Checking the Body Structure\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Checking-the-Body-Structure\">Checking the Body Structure</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>See how large the dog is. Chow Chows are not small dogs. They are tall and can weigh between .<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-1.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Check the dog's tail. Chows have high-set tails. Their tails are carried closely to their backs.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-2.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Spot small ears. Sometimes hard to find, the ears of a Chow Chow are small and triangular.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup> They stand erect, slightly tilted, and are firm at the base and slightly rounded at the tip.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a7/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-3.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Inspect the eyes of the dog. Chows have dark brown eyes. Their eyes, placed wide apart, are deep set and resemble the shape of almonds.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/02/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-4.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Look for a blue tongue.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup> Perhaps one of the Chow's most identifiable traits is a blue or purple tongue. If you see the dog's short, broad muzzle<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup> as it opens its mouth, see if it has a blue tongue.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-5.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Notice the dog's build. Chow Chows have strongly musculed bodies. They are described as short, broad, and compact.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup> They have a stilted, stiff-legged gait.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c0/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-6.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Identify-a-Chow-Chow&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Noticing the Coat\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Noticing-the-Coat\">Noticing the Coat</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Check the dog's coat color. Chow Chows have five coat colors: red, black, blue, cinnamon, and cream, all of which are equally accepted by the AKC.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup> Red and cream coats can range from light to dark.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-7.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Look at the length of the coat. There are two types of coats seen in Chows: rough and smooth. Rough Chow Chows are frequently seen in dog shows, and they have long fur that makes a ruff around their heads. They also have feathered tails.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup> Smooth Chows have less of a ruff and feathering.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-8.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Assess how the coat feels. Chow Chows have double-coats. Their outer coats are dense, straight, and coarse, while their undercoats are soft, thick, and wooly.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-9.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Identify-a-Chow-Chow&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Identifying Temperament\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Identifying-Temperament\">Identifying Temperament</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Recognize a cat-like personality. Chow Chows have interesting personalities in that they somewhat act like cats. They are aloof and typically only make close bonds with their owner rather than others.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-10.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Notice independence. Chows do things on their own. They can make good watchdogs or guard dogs because their independent personalities lead to them making their own decisions.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-11.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Check for aggression. Around others, Chows can show signs of aggression. They don't easily allow others into their home and may bite or growl.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup> They shouldn't be around cats or small animals due to their hunting instincts and may be aggressive around other dogs.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-12.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>See if the dog is calm. Chows have a calm and quiet disposition. They are not very destructive and usually don't act entirely aggressive unless provoked.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/18/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-13.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Look for loyalty. Chows may have some negative traits, but if it's just them and their owner, they can become very loyal. Despite being independent and stubborn, they have the potential to show loyalty to one person close to them.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Chow-Chow#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Identify a Chow Chow Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6b/Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-14.jpg/aid12024486-v4-728px-Identify-a-Chow-Chow-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Identify-a-Chow-Chow&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If you're trying to figure out the breed of your dog, consider using a <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Test-Dog-DNA-and-Analyze-Parentage\" title=\"Test Dog DNA and Analyze Parentage\">DNA test</a>, as this will confirm their breed.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Identify-a-Chow-Chow&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Shar%E2%80%90Pei\" title=\"Identify a Shar‐Pei\">Identify a Shar‐Pei</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Pug\" title=\"Identify a Pug\">Identify a Pug</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Shih-Tzu\" title=\"Identify a Shih Tzu\">Identify a Shih Tzu</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Identify-a-Pekingese\" title=\"Identify a Pekingese\">Identify a Pekingese</a></li>\n </ul> \n 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Report Credit Card Fraud","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Suspicious activity or unrecognized charges on your credit card statement might be signs of identity theft. If you believe you are the victim of credit card fraud, it is imperative to act quickly. Identity theft and accounted for more than 13 percent of consumer complaints registered with the Federal Trade Commission (FTC) in 2014.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Report-Credit-Card-Fraud&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Report-Credit-Card-Fraud&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Notifying Your Card Issuer\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Notifying-Your-Card-Issuer\">Notifying Your Card Issuer</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Call your card issuer. Call immediately as soon as you suspect fraudulent activity. The toll free number of your credit card issuer can be found on the back of your credit card. If your card has been lost or stolen, refer to <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"http://www.creditcards.com/bank-partner-contact-information.php\">this list of credit issuers’ contact information</a> published by CreditCards.com.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Once you notify your card issuer, they will initiate an investigation. Your card issuer will also contact merchants and reverse any fraudulent charges. You are not responsible for any charges that occur once you report the fraud.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Federal law states that if you are unable to report a lost or stolen card before it is used, you can only be held liable for up to $50 of fraudulent charges.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Follow up with written notification. Send a letter to your credit card issuer. Include your credit card number and the date you initially filed the report. If your card was lost or stolen, reference the date in the letter. If your found suspicious or fraudulent activity on your statement, report that information in the letter.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Complete a credit card fraud affidavit. The credit card issuer will may send you a fraud affidavit. If they don’t, complete an <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/articles/pdf-0094-identity-theft-affidavit.pdf\">FTC Identity Theft Affidavit</a>. This is a formal statement of the facts surrounding your case.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup> You will need this affidavit when reporting the fraud to the police and to the credit reporting agencies.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sign and date the form in the presence of a law enforcement officer or a notary.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>The affidavit will ask for personal information, such as your name, address and Social Security number.</li> \n    <li>You will be asked to report information about the fraud, such as the name of the person who used your credit card (if you know it) and any other information you know about the crime.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Report-Credit-Card-Fraud&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Filing a Police Report\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Filing-a-Police-Report\">Filing a Police Report</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Contact the police department in the city where you live. You can go to the police station or ask for an officer to come to your home. Provide any relevant information you know about the credit card fraud. Be prepared to share your personal information and to provide your contact information.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/78/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You do not have to pay any fees to file a police report.</li> \n    <li>You will need your credit card fraud affidavit. Use the one provided by your card issuer or the FTC Identity Theft Affidavit.</li> \n    <li>Have a government-issued photo identification with you, such as a driver’s license.</li> \n    <li>Bring proof of your address, such as a copy of your mortgage statement or a utilities bill.</li> \n    <li>Submit proof of the theft, such as credit card statements or IRS notices.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Keep a copy of the police report and the case number. Ask for a copy of the police report to keep for your records. The police department will issue a case number for your report. Refer to the case number if you have to contact the police about your case.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d4/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Understand why filing a police report is necessary. The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) recommends filing a police report. The police may not be instrumental in identifying the person who committed the fraud. However, filing a report firmly establishes your innocence should you need to contest charges down the road. In addition, filing a police report notifies law enforcement authorities about financial crimes that are occurring in the area.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup> \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Report-Credit-Card-Fraud&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Contacting the Credit Bureaus\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Contacting-the-Credit-Bureaus\">Contacting the Credit Bureaus</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Place a fraud alert with one of the three credit reporting bureaus. The three credit reporting bureaus are TransUnion, Equifax and Experian. You only need to contact one of them. Once you do, that agency will contact the other two.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/92/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Visit Equifax Credit Report Assistance, or call 1-888-766-0008.</li> \n    <li>Go to the <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://www.experian.com/fraud/center.html\">Experian Fraud Center</a>, or call 1-888-397-3742.</li> \n    <li>Go to the <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"http://www.transunion.com/fraud\">TransUnion Fraud Alert</a> page, or call 1-800-680-7289.</li> \n    <li>The credit reporting agencies will send you a letter to verify that the fraud alert has been placed on your file.</li> \n    <li>Placing a fraud alert is free. It remains on your file for 90 days.</li> \n    <li>A fraud alert protects you because it requires businesses to contact you before issuing credit in your name.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Obtain a copy of your credit report. Placing a fraud alert entitles you to a free copy of your credit report. Follow the directions on your fraud alert confirmation to obtain your credit report.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b9/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-8.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also get a free credit report once per year from <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"http://www.annualcreditreport.com/\">annualcreditreport.com</a> or by calling 1-877-322-8228.</li> \n    <li>If you have already received your free credit report, you can pay any of the credit reporting agencies to receive an immediate copy of your credit report.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Review your credit report. Note any unusual or suspicious activity. Look for unauthorized transactions on your credit card accounts. Report any unauthorized credit activity to the credit issuer. Use information from your credit report when completing your police report and your report to the FTC.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup> \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-9.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Report-Credit-Card-Fraud&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Filing a Report with the Federal Trade Commission\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Filing-a-Report-with-the-Federal-Trade-Commission\">Filing a Report with the Federal Trade Commission</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Complete the Federal Trade Commission’s (FTC’s) <a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"https://www.ftccomplaintassistant.gov/#crnt&amp;panel1-1\">online complaint form</a>. Select the identity theft category. Then select the appropriate subcategory related to your case, such as data breach, lost wallet or purse or identity theft. Follow the prompts to submit all of the relevant information about the crime. Skip any items that don’t apply to you, and provide as many details as you can.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-10.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Give details about the identity theft. Provide the date on which you noticed the <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Protect-Yourself-from-Identity-Theft\" title=\"Protect Yourself from Identity Theft\">identity theft</a>. Indicate how much time and money you have spent trying to resolve the matter yourself. Submit details about the credit issuer and the type of credit account that has been used. Indicate whether you intend to file a complaint against the company. Tell whether you have been contacted by debt collectors about this account.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-11.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Provide information about the person who stole your identity. If you know who stole your identity or fraudulently used your credit card, fill out what you know. Provide the person’s name and address. Indicate how the person is related to you, if applicable. Note how you think the person got a hold of your information.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-12.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tell whether or not you have contacted law enforcement. If you have filed a police report, include this information. Provide the date you filed the police report. Indicate the name and location of the police department. Fill in the name of the officer who took the report. Provide the officer’s contact information.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-13.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Provide information about fraud alerts. Indicate whether you have contacted any of the credit bureaus and placed a fraud alert on your file. Note whether you have a complaint about any of the credit reporting agencies. Identify what information on your credit report is now inaccurate as a result of the crime. Provide information about credit inquiries that appear on your report as a result of the identity theft.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-14.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Verify your identity. Provide information verifying your identity, such as your name, address and contact information. Indicate how long you have lived at your current address. Provide your driver’s license number if you have one. Include your date of birth and your Social Security number.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/51/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-15.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tell your story in your own words. In the comments section of the document, you can write about what happened. Provide any additional information that wasn’t covered in any of the previous sections. Don’t repeat your Social Security number, date of birth or any account numbers in this section. You can enter up to 1000 characters in this section.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-16.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Review and submit your complaint. Review the information you have provided. Make any necessary edits. Once you are satisfied that the information is correct, click on “Submit” to file your complaint with the FTC. Print out a copy of the complaint and keep it for your records.<sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-17.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Report Credit Card Fraud Step 17.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/45/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-17.jpg/aid1331607-v4-728px-Report-Credit-Card-Fraud-Step-17.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Report-Credit-Card-Fraud&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Credit-Card-Fraud\" title=\"Prevent Credit Card Fraud\">Prevent Credit Card Fraud</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Fraud-Alert-on-Your-Credit-Report\" title=\"Put a Fraud Alert on Your Credit Report\">Put a Fraud Alert on Your Credit Report</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Report-Credit-Card-Fraud&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/blog/consumers-told-it-ftc-top-10-complaints-2014\">https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/blog/consumers-told-it-ftc-top-10-complaints-2014</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.creditcards.com/privacy-security-suite/if-youre-a-victim.php\">http://www.creditcards.com/privacy-security-suite/if-youre-a-victim.php</a></span> </li> \n id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Report-Credit-Card-Fraud#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer href=\"https://www.identitytheft.gov/AdditionalInformation\">https://www.identitytheft.gov/AdditionalInformation</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-20\"><a target=\"_blank\"
