noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1019538-candy-apples\">https://cooking.nytimes.com/recipes/1019538-candy-apples</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 24 Oct 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid60426-v4-728px-Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-1-Version-4.jpg","linkMd5":"c950549925e8ddbd2561fc4038d6bbc4","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn24@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-38-379_e1bb1ac89a43913b.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":46416,"destBytes":26578,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid60426-v4-728px-Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-1-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn24@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-38-379_e1bb1ac89a43913b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-5-Version-4.jpg/aid60426-v4-728px-Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-5-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn72@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-21-885_8214542e5f0a03c8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/43/Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-6-Version-4.jpg/aid60426-v4-728px-Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-6-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn54@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-19-759_63535e1ca09a9a7f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-11-Version-4.jpg/aid60426-v4-728px-Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-11-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn4@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-18-512_1bf5d2af3975cd44.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-12-Version-4.jpg/aid60426-v4-728px-Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-12-Version-4.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ef/Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-14-Version-3.jpg/aid60426-v4-728px-Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-14-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn30@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-17-146_e2b3946881dfeace.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7a/Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-16.jpg/aid60426-v4-728px-Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn54@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-16-738_9c5c2bba3569131b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7c/Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-18.jpg/aid60426-v4-728px-Make-Toffee-Apples-Step-18.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn100@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-19-514_12868648fd2e6b2e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817618063},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Sign Numbers in British Sign Language","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>British Sign Language is an official language recognised by the United Kingdom, used mostly by those in the deaf community. Numbers are an essential part of sign language, and are needed for many conversations. This wikiHow will teach you how to sign numbers to help you sign your age, time or date to help you to communicate with those who are deaf. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Understanding the Basics When Signing Numbers\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Understanding-the-Basics-When-Signing-Numbers\">Understanding the Basics When Signing Numbers</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Understand that signing numbers only uses your dominant hand. When signing all numbers, you only use your dominant hand. Your non-dominant hand is not used at all for numbers. To avoid confusion with other signs, position this hand by your side.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-1.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This ensures that the deaf person knows that you are signing a number and not something else.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Know the correct hand positioning when signing numbers. It is important when signing numbers that numbers are signed a few inches away directly in front of your body.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don't sign too high or too low from the centre of your body, otherwise, the other person won't be able to see what you are signing.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn to mouth the number you are signing. When you are signing a number, it is important that you mouth the number at the same time. This is so that the other person knows that you are signing a number and so won't confuse it with another sign.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-3.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don't say the number using your voice, just use your lips to show the number you are signing.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Signing the Numbers 1-10\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Signing-the-Numbers-1-10\">Signing the Numbers 1-10</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Know the signs for the numbers 1-5. These signs are very simple and are used when signing numbers higher than 19. The signs for 1-5 are very simple:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/05/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-4.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sign the number 1 <sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Use your dominant hand and put your index finger upwards, keeping the rest of your fingers in a fist, ensuring that the palm of your hand is facing inwards (towards your body).</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 2 <sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Use your dominant hand to point your index and middle finger upwards, making a 'V' shape. Make sure the rest of your fingers are in a fist and your palm is facing your body.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 3 <sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Using your dominant hand, point your index, middle and ring fingers upwards, forming a 'W' shape. Keep the rest of your fingers in a fist, pointing inwards towards you. Make sure your fingers are separate and not touching.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 4 <sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Using your dominant hand, point your fingers upwards except for your thumb. Hold this central to your body a few inches away from your chest. Keep your thumb behind your other four fingers. Make sure to leave a small, even space between your fingers making sure your fingers are not touching.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 5 <sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Use your dominant hand to hold up all five fingers centrally in front of you, a few inches away from your chest. Keep the palm of your hand facing towards you. Make sure you leave even gaps between your fingers ensuring that your fingers are not touching each other.</li>\n     </ul></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn how to sign the numbers 6-10. These numbers are combined with the numbers 1-5 to sign numbers from 20 upwards. These signs are very simple and easy to remember.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sign the number 6 <sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Use your dominant hand to make a thumbs up. Then, keeping your fingers in a fist and your thumb facing upwards, bend the knuckle of your thumb to make a 90-degrees angle shape. Doing this ensures that the deaf person does not confuse this sign with \"ok\". Make sure to sign this centrally in front of you, a few inches away from your chest.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 7 <sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Place your dominant hand a few inches away from your chest and make a 'thumbs up' and point your index finger outwards, keeping the rest of your fingers in a fist shape.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 8 <sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Make a thumbs up with your dominant hand a few inches away from your chest. At the same time, point your index and middle finger outwards, keeping your thumb in the same position.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 9 <sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Use your dominant hand placed a few inches away from your chest to make a thumbs up. Keeping your pinky finger bent, extend all your other fingers outwards, leaving your thumb pointing upwards.</li> \n      <li>An alternative is to bend in your thumb whilst having your other fingers pointing outwards, like the sign for four rotated 90 degrees.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 10 <sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>. \n     <ul>\n      <li>Hold your dominant hand horizontally, a few inches in front of your chest with your palm facing towards you and shake or twist your hand slightly.</li> \n      <li>Some people sign the number 10 by holding up all ten fingers, with palm facing their chest.</li>\n     </ul></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Signing the Numbers 11-19\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Signing-the-Numbers-11-19\">Signing the Numbers 11-19</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Understand that these signs are unique. The signs for the numbers 11-19 are different from signing 1-10. For example, you do not combine 1 and 1 to make the sign for 11.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-6.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Learn the signs for the numbers 11-15. The signs for 11-15 are very similar to the signs for 1-10 but are notably different. These signs are very simple:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-7.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sign the number 11: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Using your dominant hand positioned a few inches away from your chest, put your wrist forwards and tap your thumb and index finger together twice, making sure that they are pointing forwards. Keep the rest of your fingers in a fisted position.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 12: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Point the wrist of your dominant hand up and forwards. Put your thumb forwards and tap your index and middle fingers on top of your thumb twice.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 13: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Using your dominant hand, hold out your index, middle and ring finger horizontally, keeping your thumb and pinky finger in a fist. Then, shake twice. Make sure your palm is facing towards your body, a few inches away from your chest.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 14: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Using your dominant hand, hold out your index, middle, ring and pinky finger horizontally, keeping your thumb behind, shake twice. Make sure your palm is facing towards your body, a few inches away from your chest.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 15: \n     <ul>\n      <li>With your dominant hand, hold up all five fingers centrally in front of you, a few inches away from your chest. Starting with your palm facing you, quickly rotate your hand the opposite way, then back again.</li>\n     </ul></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn how to sign the numbers 16-19. These signs are different to the signs for 11-15, although they are similar to the signs for 6-9. These signs are simple:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/81/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-8.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sign the number 16: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Make a thumbs up with your dominant hand, a few inches away from your chest. Bend the tip of your thumb slightly and move up and down twice.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 17: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Making a thumbs up with your dominant hand, point your index finger outwards, to the side. Move your wrist up and down twice.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 18: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Using your dominant hand, make a thumbs up a few inches away from your chest. Then, point out your pointer and middle finger and move this up and down twice.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 19: \n     <ul>\n      <li>Making a thumbs up with your dominant hand, point out your pointer, middle and ring finger. Move this position up and down twice.</li>\n     </ul></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Signing the Numbers 20-99\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Signing-the-Numbers-20-99\">Signing the Numbers 20-99</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Learn the signs for 20-29 first. Once you understand the signs for 21-29, these can be repeated for other numbers that aren’t multiples of 10. You just need to amend the signs to match the correct numbers. eg: 21 is a 2 and a 1, and then to sign 31, you’d replace the 2 with a 3.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/49/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-9.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Start by learning the numbers for 20-25.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-10.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sign the number 20 \n     <ul>\n      <li>Sign the number two in front of your non-dominant shoulder, by holding two fingers upward with your palm facing toward you, in front of your non-dominant shoulder. Then, sign zero, by making your fingers into a round “o” shape and place this in front of your dominant shoulder.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 21 \n     <ul>\n      <li>Use the sign for the number two by putting two fingers up, palm facing towards you in front of your non-dominant shoulder. Then, sign the number one (as above), and position this in front of your dominant shoulder.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 22 \n     <ul>\n      <li>Sign the number two, by putting two fingers upward, with the back of your hand pointing outward in front of your non-dominant shoulder. Then, repeat the number two sign in front of your dominant shoulder.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 23 \n     <ul>\n      <li>Sign the number two by holding up two fingers, palm facing towards you, in front of your non-dominant shoulder. Then, move your hand over to the right and sign the number 3 by holding three fingers up, palm facing towards you in front of your dominant shoulder.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 24 \n     <ul>\n      <li>Sign the number two by holding up two fingers, with your palm facing you, in front of your non-dominant shoulder. Then sign the number four, by putting four fingers up with your palm facing you, in front of your dominant shoulder.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 25 \n     <ul>\n      <li>Sign number two in front of your non-dominant shoulder, then move your hand to in front of your right shoulder and sign the number five, by holding out a five with the back of your hand in front of your dominant shoulder.</li>\n     </ul></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn the numbers 26-29. After you’ve learnt the signs for the numbers 20-24, you can start to learn the numbers 26-29.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-11.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Sign the number 26 \n     <ul>\n      <li>First, sign the number two (as above), in front of your non-dominant shoulder, then move your hand to the right and make a thumbs up and bend the knuckle of your thumb to make a 90-degrees angle shape to sign the number six in front of your non-dominant shoulder.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 27 \n     <ul>\n      <li>Sign the number two in front of your non-dominant shoulder, then move your hand to the front of your opposite shoulder and make a 'thumbs up' and point your index finger outwards, keeping the rest of your fingers in a fist shape.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 28 \n     <ul>\n      <li>First, sign the number two in front of your non-dominant shoulder, then make a thumbs up with your dominant hand in front of your opposite shoulder. At the same time, point your index and middle finger outwards, keeping your thumb in the same position.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>Sign the number 29 \n     <ul>\n      <li>First, sign the number two (as above), in front of your non-dominant shoulder, then move your hand to the right and make a thumbs up with your dominant hand, point out your pointer, middle and ring finger to sign the number nine in front of your mom dominant shoulder.</li>\n     </ul></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Repeat these signs with other numbers up to 99, adapting the signs to match the number you want to sign.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-12.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, to sign the number 30, use the above instructions to sign the number three, then the number zero.</li> \n    <li>Make sure to mouth the numbers as you sign them, to make it clear to the other person that you are signing a number.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Signing Larger Numbers\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Signing-Larger-Numbers\">Signing Larger Numbers</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Learn how to sign a hundred. Sign the number one, by putting your index finger up, palm facing inward in front of your dominant shoulder. Then sign “hundred” by using your index finger horizontally towards the opposite side.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/20/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-13.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Repeat this for all other signs in the hundreds, and change the number to match the one you need to sign, followed by the sign for “hundred”.</li> \n    <li>To sign numbers within the hundreds, sign the first number and hundred signs first, followed by the other numbers.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn how to sign a thousand. To sign a thousand, sign the number one, by putting your index finger upward, palm facing inward in front of your dominant shoulder. Then, sign “thousand” by using your index finger to make a comma in front of and to the side of your dominant shoulder.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-14.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can repeat this to sign other numbers in the thousands, by adapting the first number to match the number of thousands you want to sign.</li> \n    <li>To sign numbers within the thousands, sign the number of thousands followed by the sign for a thousand. Then, add the signs for the other numbers.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Know how to sign a million. To sign a million, sign the number one by holding your index finger upwards, with your palm facing inward in front of your dominant shoulder. Then, sign the letter “M” by placing the first three fingers on your dominant hand onto the palm of your non-dominant hand.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Sign Numbers in British Sign Language Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a6/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-15.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can adapt this sign by changing the number one to match the number of millions you need to sign, followed by the sign for “million”.</li> \n    <li>To sign numbers within the millions, sign the number of millions, followed by the sign for million. Then, add the signs of the other numbers after this.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-1.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"117a588067c52593061fb3833d6103e3","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn26@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-53-41-399_6fde5c47064a2c67.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":31195,"destBytes":18398,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-1.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn26@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-53-41-399_6fde5c47064a2c67.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn65@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-21-375_f90aab1af52a42eb.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-3.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn50@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-18-441_a0430532b0e69f1f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/05/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-4.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn67@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-15-820_efaee2af4525331c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn73@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-21-547_f3eaeca0f3690203.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-6.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn37@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-17-266_c45d67f3048e142d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-7.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn9@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-17-994_a763113d46c0034e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/81/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-8.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn86@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-16-990_a12934fc1b2d9a3f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/49/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-9.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn100@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-20-787_123909b4fc5525d3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/75/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-10.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn62@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-20-693_a504de372bfecd71.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-11.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn20@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-19-498_cadeb17d92d269e4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-12.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn91@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-20-049_b66755c7b06eb98b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/20/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-13.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn53@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-22-824_1eaac3cb470ea78c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ed/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-14.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-14.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn8@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-19-490_7c3fdb848c2ef0ca.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a6/Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-15.jpg/aid10860469-v4-728px-Sign-Numbers-in-British-Sign-Language-Step-15.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn18@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-18-027_23abde8a2bad8ef7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817618079},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Join a Zoom Meeting on Android","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>This wikiHow teaches you how to join a Zoom Meeting on Android. Zoom meeting invitations are sent via email. Before you can accept an email invitation, you must download the Zoom app for Android.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Using an Email Invite\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-an-Email-Invite\">Using an Email Invite</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Open the Google Play Store . It's the app that has an icon that resembles a colorful 'play' triangle.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-1.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Type in the search bar. The search bar is at the top of the screen. This displays a list of apps that match your search.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-2.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap . It's in the list of apps that match your search. This displays the app info page for Zoom Cloud Meetings.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-3.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap . It's the green button on the right below the banner at the top of the app info page. This installs Zoom Cloud Meetings on your device.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fa/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-4.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Check your email. Zoom meeting invites are typically sent via email, so check there for your meeting invite.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/53/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-5.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Open the email invitation. Zoom email invitations typically have \"Please join Zoom meeting in progress\" as the subject.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-6.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap the Meeting URL. The URL is at the top of the email below the text that says \"Join Zoom Meeting\". This displays a pop-up asking which app you want to open the URL with.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-7.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Select the Zoom app and tap . The first time you join a Zoom meeting invite, a pop-up displays asking you which app you want to use. Tap the Zoom app icon. It's a blue icon with an image that resembles a video camera. Then tap <b>Always</b> to indicate that you always want to open Zoom invite URLs with the Zoom app. This opens the Zoom app with the meeting.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/97/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-8.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If asked to allow Zoom to use your phone's microphone and camera, tap <b>Allow</b>.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Using a Meeting ID Number\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-a-Meeting-ID-Number\">Using a Meeting ID Number</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Download and install the Zoom Cloud Meetings app. The Zoom Cloud Meetings app is available from the Google Play Store. Use the following steps to download and install Zoom Cloud Meetings:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-9.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Open the Google Play Store.</li> \n    <li>Type \"Zoom Cloud Meetings\" in the search bar.</li> \n    <li>Tap <b>Zoom Cloud Meetings</b>.</li> \n    <li>Tap <b>Install</b> below the Zoom Cloud Meetings bar.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Open Zoom Cloud Meetings. Once Zoom Cloud Meetings is installed, you can open it by tapping <b>OPEN</b> in the Google Play Store, or by tapping the Zoom icon on your Homescreen. It has a blue icon with a white image that resembles a video camera.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-10.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap the button. The Join button is the second button at the top of the screen. It's a blue icon with a plus sign (+) in the middle.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-11.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Type the meeting ID number. Use the bar at the top to type the 9-digit meeting ID number without dashes. You can get this number from the meeting host, or from the email invitation.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-12.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap . It's the button below the bar at the top of the screen. The button turns blue when you have entered a valid Meeting ID number. This joins the meeting.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Join a Zoom Meeting on Android Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-13.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To join without audio, tap the toggle switch next to \"Don't Connect To Audio\" below the blue button.</li> \n    <li>If you don't wish to be seen on camera when you join a meeting, tap the toggle switch next to, \"Turn off my video\".</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span droid-Step-7.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn51@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-15-878_4206c7b34e6b4c34.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/97/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-8.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn93@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-21-909_2efcf8fff7af2557.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-9.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn14@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-18-004_0f314acece8f875b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-10.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn7@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-22-429_bc42c655f2457643.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-11.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn84@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-20-791_9427ca1d2ce609ab.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-12.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn73@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-20-619_b0d2924a2da43a42.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-13.jpg/aid10815912-v4-728px-Join-a-Zoom-Meeting-on-Android-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn74@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-17-123_41a2f1dbe22cdb13.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817618055},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Cook Medium Rare Steak","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Chefs know exactly how long to cook a steak in order to bring out the natural juiciness. Cooking a restaurant-worthy porterhouse, T-bone or fillet requires perfect timing and heat. Medium rare is often considered the best compromise between the natural taste of the meat and a seared crust. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Prepping the Meat\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Prepping-the-Meat\">Prepping the Meat</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Remove the steak from the refrigerator about 20 minutes before you plan to cook it. Never defrost a steak in the microwave. It should be slowly defrosted in a refrigerator overnight.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Pat the meat dry with paper towels if it is very juicy. This will help the spices cling to the surface evenly.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Sprinkle a mix of salt and pepper onto the surface of the steak right before you cook it. Salt will create a crust, but putting it on too early will make the juice run out of it. Use up to 1 tsp. (6g) of salt per side for a large steak.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b6/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Ultimately, the amount of salt and pepper you use will be to taste. Use what you feel is a generous amount.</li> \n    <li>Freshly cracked pepper and flaked sea salt will produce the best flavor.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Find out how thick the steak is. This will help in determining cooking time later on. A one-inch (2.5-cm) cut will need less time than a 2-inch (5-cm) cut and so on. Steaks that tend to be best at medium rare doneness are usually on the thicker side. \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/19/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Heating the Pan\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Heating-the-Pan\">Heating the Pan</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Heat a frying pan or grill to high heat. A grill will give you a charred finish to the steak, while a sturdy frying pan will provide the most even cooking surface.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Many chefs suggest either a non-stick pan or a cast-iron pan. The non-stick will allow you to use less oil, while the cast-iron pan has the most even cooking temperature.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Brush oil directly onto both sides of the steak or pour 1 tbsp. <b>(15ml) of oil into the pan.</b> Use olive oil or groundnut oil. When the oil starts to separate or a drop of water sizzles on the surface, it is ready for your meat. \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Cooking the Steak Medium Rare\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cooking-the-Steak-Medium-Rare\">Cooking the Steak Medium Rare</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Use tongs to lift your steak and place it in the pan. You should hear a loud sizzle immediately. If you don’t, your pan or grill is not hot enough.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/17/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Feel the steak’s surface as you lift it. It should be very soft with plenty of give to it when it’s raw.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Don’t touch the steak until it is ready to be flipped. A medium rare steak should only be flipped once.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b7/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Aim to cook a thin steak for 2 minutes on each side. Cook a 2-inch cut for four minutes on each side.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Flip the steak using tongs. Avoid using a fork, since it will puncture the meat, letting the juices escape.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Cook for the same amount of time as you did on the first side.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Test the doneness of the steak by feel. Use the tongs to judge how soft the steak has become. A medium rare steak should be bouncy. A medium to well done steak will be firmer.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 12 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9d/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Remove the steak from the pan or grill when it feels bouncy to the touch. Cover it with aluminum foil to rest for half the time you cooked it. It will reabsorb the juices. Don’t wait more than 10 minutes before serving.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 13 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The steak continues to cook for a few minutes while it rests, so wait patiently for the steak to come to the right internal temperature of 135 degrees Fahrenheit (57 degrees Celsius).<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Serve the steak immediately. Use a steak knife to cut across the grain. Once cut, the center should be reddish pink, with lighter shades of pink radiating toward the golden brown crust.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Medium Rare Steak Step 14 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/67/Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-14-Version-3.jpg/aid6294870-v4-728px-Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>You can use a meat thermometer to ensure the internal temperature reaches 135 degrees (and no more); however, this is not recommended because you must puncture the meat before it’s done resting. Using touch and time will help you avoid this.</li> \n  <li>Try pouring your olive oil and seasonings on a plate and then placing your steak on top to create a better-seared finish on your steak.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Steak</li> \n  <li>Salt</li> \n  <li>Pepper</li> \n  <li>Paper towels</li> \n  <li>Frying pan/grill</li> \n  <li>Olive oil</li> \n  <li>Seasoning brush</li> \n  <li>Plate</li> \n  <li>Tongs</li> \n  <li>Timer</li> \n  <li>Aluminum foil</li> \n  <li>Steak knife</li> \n  <li>Meat thermometer (optional)</li>\n </ul> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Medium-Rare-Steak&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" Steak in a Frying Pan</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Top-Sirloin-Steak\" title=\"Cook Top Sirloin Steak\">Cook Top Sirloin Steak</a></li>\n </ul> \n
