</ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 23 Oct 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Get-a-Credit-Card-With-No-Credit-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid460007-v4-728px-Get-a-Credit-Card-With-No-Credit-Step-10-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"5c600cc3a76a2567b01a94ac9f0dbc11","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn38@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-43-157_0bbc39c42c0f57d6.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":71743,"destBytes":43294,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1d/Get-a-Credit-Card-With-No-Credit-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid460007-v4-728px-Get-a-Credit-Card-With-No-Credit-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn38@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-43-157_0bbc39c42c0f57d6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Contact-the-IRS-Step-17.jpg/aid460007-v4-728px-Contact-the-IRS-Step-17.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/63/Develop-a-Relationship-With-a-Customer-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid460007-v4-728px-Develop-a-Relationship-With-a-Customer-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn5@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-18-129_592027894e1f7fc3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3a/Announce-Your-Retirement-Step-8.jpg/aid460007-v4-728px-Announce-Your-Retirement-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn33@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-19-751_8045bc5818b065c5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Prepare-a-Power-of-Attorney-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid460007-v4-728px-Prepare-a-Power-of-Attorney-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn72@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-18-573_259251d0a432a368.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Get-a-Credit-Card-With-No-Credit-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid460007-v4-728px-Get-a-Credit-Card-With-No-Credit-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn22@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-17-217_5de4188a2ffdc958.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0b/Get-a-Credit-Card-With-No-Credit-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid460007-v4-728px-Get-a-Credit-Card-With-No-Credit-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn42@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-21-139_9c5c1d593d9ff334.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Write-a-Grant-Proposal-Step-17-Version-3.jpg/aid460007-v4-728px-Write-a-Grant-Proposal-Step-17-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn15@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-20-346_8e13d3c636f1d14d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817618064},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Preserve Leaf Color","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Traditional drying methods often remove the color from beautiful leaves. To keep the colors of your leaves as close to their original shade as possible, you’ll need to seal the leaves with wax, remove the moisture with borax, or replace the moisture with glycerin. Using wax is the best way to do this, but the wax will leave the leaves in a thick, shiny, texture. Drying your leaves in borax is the easiest method, but your greens may get washed out a little. Soaking leaves in glycerin is a great way to preserve colors, but it’s labor intensive and the shades of green may become darker. Choose a method based on how much time you have and what kind of texture you’re trying to achieve. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Using Wax to Preserve Leaves\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-Wax-to-Preserve-Leaves\">Using Wax to Preserve Leaves</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Iron your leaves between 2 sheets of wax paper to remove the moisture. Lay a pillowcase down on a table and set a sheet of wax paper on top of it. Set your leaves on top of this sheet of wax paper and put a second layer of wax paper on top. Cover the wax paper with a second pillowcase. Set an iron to low heat and run it across your leaves for 3-5 minutes to remove the moisture trapped in your leaves.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Preserve Leaf Color Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This is the best way to naturally preserve the colors of a leaf. It will change the texture dramatically, though. The wax will dry on top of the leaves, leaving them with a slick, reflective texture.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Melt 1 tablespoon (14 g) of wax for each of your leaves in a double boiler. Depending on their size, your leaves will need roughly (14 g) of wax to coat them on each side. Cut a small block of beeswax or paraffin wax off from a larger piece as needed and set it in the center of your double boiler’s upper pot. Heat the double boiler over medium heat for 5-8 minutes until the wax melts.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don’t have a double boiler, fill a nonstick pot halfway with water. Then, place a large glass bowl on top of the rim of the pot so that it isn’t touching the water.</li> \n    <li>For example, if you’re preserving 3 leaves, (42 g) of wax should be plenty. Adjust the amount of wax you use as needed.</li> \n    <li>The result will be the same regardless of whether you use paraffin wax or beeswax.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Remove the upper pot in your double boiler and set it on a cloth. Set a towel down on a stable work surface. Put on oven mitts and set the bowl of melted wax on top of the towel. Set your leaves on top of a sheet of wax paper and set it next to the towel.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Preserve Leaf Color Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Use a pair of pliers to dunk the leaves in your wax for 1-2 seconds. Grab your first leaf gently by the stem with needle-nose pliers. Then, dunk the leaf into the wax for 1-2 seconds. Slide the stem around in the wax to submerge it completely. If you melted a small amount of wax, flip the leaf over in the melted wax to coat both sides.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Transfer the leaves to wax paper and let them dry for 3-5 minutes. Move your first leaf over the top of the wax paper and let any excess wax drip off. Then, set the leaf down on the wax paper. Repeat this process for every leaf that you’re preserving by dipping it in the wax and setting it out. Wait 3-5 minutes for your leaves to dry.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Preserve Leaf Color Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can air dry your leaves by hanging the stems from clothespins if you prefer.</li> \n    <li>You can repeat this process to add another layer of glycerin if you want it thoroughly protected.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Drying Leaves with Borax\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Drying-Leaves-with-Borax\">Drying Leaves with Borax</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Mix 1 part borax with 2 parts white or yellow cornmeal. Add 1 part pure powdered borax and 2 parts white or yellow cornmeal to a glass bowl and stir them with a wooden spoon. You need enough of this mixture to completely cover your leaves, so weigh your ingredients as needed. You need to completely cover your leaves with this mixture. If you’re only preserving 3-5 leaves, you can use 1/2 cup (65 g) of borax and 1 cup (130 g) of cornmeal. Adjust your measurements as needed based on the number of leaves and the shape of your container.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can get cornmeal and borax at a grocery store. Borax is a cleaning agent commonly found in laundry detergents.</li> \n    <li>This method works best with bright flowers and leaves. Green plant matter will become slightly duller using this process.</li> \n    <li>It doesn’t matter if you use white or yellow cornmeal.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Coat the bottom of a glass pan or paper box with your borax mixture. Grab a glass pan or large cardboard box that is big enough to hold your leaves. Use a ladle or large spoon to pour a layer of your borax mixture. Spread the mixture out with the flat bottom of your spoon or ladle to create a level base.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Add the leaves that you want to preserve to the top of the borax. Take your leaves and gently drop them on top of the borax. Spread out your leaves so that they aren’t overlapping one another. Use needle-nose pliers to gently pick up individual leaves and reorient them as needed.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Preserve Leaf Color Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>So long as each leaf is surrounded on all sides by the borax, you should be fine.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cover the leaves completely with another layer of borax. Grab your spoon or ladle and add another layer of borax. Pour the borax and cornmeal gently over the leaves until they’re completely covered.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can create multiple layers if you’re drying a lot of leaves. For example, you can put 5-10 leaves on the first layer, cover them, then add another layer of 5-10 leaves and cover those.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Let the leaves dry in the borax mixture for 2 weeks. Cover the box or pan and let it sit. Wait at least 2 weeks for the leaves to dry out. The cornmeal and borax will absorb the moisture in the leaves without lifting a lot of the color out. After 2 weeks have passed, use a slotted spoon to gently lift the leaves out.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Preserve Leaf Color Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Preserving Leaves with Glycerin\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Preserving-Leaves-with-Glycerin\">Preserving Leaves with Glycerin</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Mix a solution of 2 parts warm water and 1 part glycerin. Grab a pitcher or bowl and fill it with your glycerin. Add twice as much warm water to the pitcher or bowl. Mix the glycerin and water together using a metal spoon or mixing stick. At first, the mixture will appear cloudy. Continue mixing until the cloudiness disappears and the glycerin and water become completely clear.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Unless you’re preserving more than 10 leaves, you only need about of glycerin and of water.</li> \n    <li>You can buy glycerin online, although some larger pharmacies may carry it. It is a thickening gel and preservative agent used in skin care products and food.</li> \n    <li>This is the most labor-intensive method. It is a great way to preserve the texture and colors, though. However, green shades will likely darken using this method.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill a plastic container halfway with the glycerin mixture. Grab a food-safe plastic container. It doesn’t need to be disposable, but cleaning glycerin can be kind of a pain. The plastic to-go containers you find at some restaurants are perfect for this. Pour your glycerin and water into the empty container until it is halfway full.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Preserve Leaf Color Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can use a glass container if you’d like, but you’ll need to do some serious cleaning after you’re done. Glycerin leaves an oily residue behind.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Cut the stem of your leaves using garden shears or clippers. Trim your leaves at the stem so they’re as long as you want them to be. If there isn’t much stem left, cut the final of the stem off. This wound will give the glycerin a way to seep into the leaf and replace the moisture.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This process will not work if you don’t cut the stem.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Drop your leaves into the glycerin and press them down a little. Take your leaves and set them on top of the glycerin. Use a mixing stick or the flat side of a spoon to gently press the leaves down into the glycerin. Push them down to ensure that they are fully covered.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Cover the leaves and weigh them down if they won’t stay submerged. If your leaves aren’t staying under the surface of the glycerin mixture, grab a plastic lid. Put the lid on top of the leaves and weigh it down using some small rocks or pebbles. This will keep the leaves from popping back up.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Leave your leaves in the glycerin for at least 24 hours. The longer you leave the leaves in the glycerin, the more effective this process will be. However, the longer you let the leaves soak, the more likely the color is to change. Let the leaves soak for at least 24 hours and no longer than 2 weeks to ensure that you preserve them without damaging the colors.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Preserve Leaf Color Step 16 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Keep the leaves in a dark area to ensure that the sun doesn’t dye the leaves while they’re soaking.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Dry your leaves with paper towels and flatten them for 3-5 days. Remove your leaves by gently lifting the stems out with your needle-nose pliers and set them on top of a dry paper towel. Set another paper towel on top of the leaves. Then, flatten the leaves by setting the towels between panes of glass or the pages of a book. Set a heavy object on top of the glass or book and leave your leaves for 3-5 days to flatten them out and dry the excess glycerin off.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup><br /><br /></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Things You’ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You’ll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.E2.80.99ll-Need\">Things You’ll Need</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Using Wax to Preserve Leaves\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-Wax-to-Preserve-Leaves_2\">Using Wax to Preserve Leaves</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Pillowcase</li> \n  <li>Iron</li> \n  <li>Glass bowl</li> \n  <li>Wax</li> \n  <li>Spoon</li> \n  <li>Pot</li> \n  <li>Water</li> \n  <li>Needle-nose pliers</li> \n  <li>Oven mitt</li> \n  <li>Wax paper</li> \n  <li>Cloth</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Drying Leaves with Borax\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Drying-Leaves-with-Borax_2\">Drying Leaves with Borax</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Borax</li> \n  <li>Cornmeal</li> \n  <li>Slotted spoon</li> \n  <li>Box or pan</li> \n  <li>Ladle or spoon</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Preserving Leaves with Glycerin\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Preserving-Leaves-with-Glycerin_2\">Preserving Leaves with Glycerin</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Glycerin</li> \n  <li>Water</li> \n  <li>Spoon</li> \n  <li>Mixing Stick</li> \n  <li>Needle nose pliers</li> \n  <li>Bowl or container</li> \n  <li>Glass panes or book</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Preserve-Leaf-Color&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/zJFpV6Al6KQ?t=56\">https://youtu.be/zJFpV6Al6KQ?t=56</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/zJFpV6Al6KQ?t=65\">https://youtu.be/zJFpV6Al6KQ?t=65</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/D2qOrDAiENE?t=193\">https://youtu.be/D2qOrDAiENE?t=193</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://extension.umd.edu/sites/extension.umd.edu/files/_images/programs/hgic/Publications/non_HGIC_FS/FS556.pdf\">https://extension.umd.edu/sites/extension.umd.edu/files/_images/programs/hgic/Publications/non_HGIC_FS/FS556.pdf</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/D2qOrDAiENE?t=278\">https://youtu.be/D2qOrDAiENE?t=278</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_ref-14\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://extension.umd.edu/sites/extension.umd.edu/files/_images/programs/hgic/Publications/non_HGIC_FS/FS556.pdf\">https://extension.umd.edu/sites/extension.umd.edu/files/_images/programs/hgic/Publications/non_HGIC_FS/FS556.pdf</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/D2qOrDAiENE?t=356\">https://youtu.be/D2qOrDAiENE?t=356</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_ref-16\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/D2qOrDAiENE?t=414\">https://youtu.be/D2qOrDAiENE?t=414</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Preserve-Leaf-Color#_ref-17\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/D2qOrDAiENE?t=621\">https://youtu.be/D2qOrDAiENE?t=621</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 22 Oct 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"19e315ff8fb7c9c379587d7942cf8fed","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn20@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-53-38-435_f493815446edb8f1.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":55440,"destBytes":30086,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn20@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-53-38-435_f493815446edb8f1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn96@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-20-766_aa1454b47a0a069e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b8/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn86@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-21-466_aa610f5edca8ced8.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8e/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn62@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-22-865_1787b3179d45a83b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/00/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn84@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-19-820_6cdbea46e71cc715.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid11670167-v4-728px-Preserve-Leaf-Color-Step-16-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn99@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-20-264_71c7483d8a8308ed.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817618070},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Make Concrete Flower Pots","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\"><p>If you're tired of expensive, flimsy pots that tip over in a windstorm and freeze in the winter, consider making your own homemade concrete pots. Once you devise a mold, you can make as many pots as you like. The sturdy flower pots are inexpensive and will last for many years.\n</p>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots&#38;action=edit&#38;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2>\n<ol><li>Create a mold for your concrete flower pot. Use two identical containers, with one container slightly larger than the other. For example, use two bowls or two buckets, as long as the smaller container is at least an inch smaller than the larger container. You can also build square or rectangular containers from plywood.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Coat the inside of the outer container and the outside of the inner container with cooking oil or non-stick cooking spray. For wooden containers, use a paste wax.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Cut at least two or three pieces of 1-inch PVC pipe. The pieces of pipe, which will be used to create drainage holes in the concrete pots, should be  long.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Put on a pair of gloves to protect your hands from the concrete mixture. Mix a batch of quick-setting concrete, according to the directions on the package. Add concrete color at this point, if desired.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Pour  of the concrete mixture into the larger container. Poke the pieces of pipe into the concrete, with  between each pipe. Smooth the concrete around the pieces of pipe, but be sure not to cover the pipe, as the pipes must be left open to create the drainage holes.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Place the smaller container carefully on top of the concrete in the center of the larger container. Press the smaller container into the concrete until the bottom of the smaller container rests on top of the pipes.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Finish adding the concrete mixture to the space between the larger and smaller container. Bounce the container lightly on a hard surface to settle the concrete, then add more to bring the concrete to the top of the container. Smooth the concrete with a putty knife.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6b/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Allow the concrete to set for at least 24 hours, then remove the smaller container to reveal your concrete pot. Mist the concrete pot lightly with a spray bottle filled with cool water. Don't remove the larger container.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Cover the concrete pot with a large piece of plastic and allow the concrete to set up for one week. Mist the concrete pot as often as needed to keep the concrete damp.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bb/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Thump the bottom of your concrete pot lightly but firmly with the heel of your hand to dislodge the pot from the container, then slide the container from your concrete pot.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e2/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Clean the concrete mixture from the small and large container. The containers can be used to make more concrete pots.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Finished.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Concrete Flower Pots Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li></ol>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots&#38;action=edit&#38;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Things You&#039;ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2>\n<ul><li>2 identically-shaped containers, one larger</li>\n<li>Cooking oil, non-stick cooking spray or paste wax</li>\n<li>1-inch PVC pipe</li>\n<li>Gloves</li>\n<li>Quick-setting concrete</li>\n<li>Concrete color (optional)</li>\n<li>Putty knife</li>\n<li>Spray bottle</li>\n<li>Larger plastic sheet</li></ul>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots&#38;action=edit&#38;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2>\n<ul><li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Concrete-Planters\" title=\"Make Concrete Planters\">Make Concrete Planters</a></li></ul>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots&#38;action=edit&#38;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n<ul><li><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external text\" href=\"http://www.howtodothings.com/home-garden/how-to-make-concrete-flower-pots\">http://www.howtodothings.com/home-garden/how-to-make-concrete-flower-pots</a></li></ul>\n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 25 Oct 2020 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"4cb009d720dba88195de73f712214183","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn11@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-53-38-470_73c7a13da7aab5e6.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":43703,"destBytes":25328,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn11@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-53-38-470_73c7a13da7aab5e6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn6@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-17-068_3d7bfd3199310a20.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn98@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-21-592_d177b9ce1faafe52.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d5/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ca/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn3@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-20-307_2d2a824b554f5469.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-6-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn11@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-19-536_aedb568b4f279a56.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6b/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn27@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-21-676_b765e54a07ecea32.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4a/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn12@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-18-675_f62930d2e90d4fec.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bb/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-9-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn24@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-22-656_7e0666b8e7b77fc9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e2/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-10-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn91@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-19-954_8e1f509a2983f34c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-11-Version-3.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1254203-v4-728px-Make-Concrete-Flower-Pots-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn96@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-18-603_3828d79639ff31b8.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817618061},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Work Out at Home As a Beginner","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Fitting in a proper workout can be difficult, especially when you’re stuck at home during the COVID-19 pandemic. Thankfully, you don’t need a gym membership or any fancy equipment to do a well-rounded workout. Experiment with different cardio and strength training exercises so you can stay fit and healthy from the comfort of your own home! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Planning Your Workout Routine\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Planning-Your-Workout-Routine\">Planning Your Workout Routine</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Fit in 150 minutes of aerobic exercise each week. Think about your weekly work schedule, along with any other obligations you have. Aim to get at least 150 minutes of aerobic exercise each week, which evens out to five 30-minute workouts each week. Try to find time throughout the week where you can fit in some aerobic exercise at home.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-01.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 01.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-01.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-01.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you can fit in a workout when you first wake up, or work out after dinner.</li> \n    <li>You can alternate workout focuses depending on the day. For example, you can dedicate Monday, Wednesday, and Friday to cardio, and dedicate Tuesday and Thursday to strength training.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Focus on strength training 2 times each week. Incorporate some kind of weight lifting or other strength training into your workouts, like deadlifts, bench presses, or another exercise of your choice. Focus on doing 1 set of 12-15 reps for all of your main muscles, like your legs, arms, back, glutes, and abdomen.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-02.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 02.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-02.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-02.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Choose a weight that provides a good workout without completely exhausting your muscles.</li> \n    <li>For instance, you can do strength training on Tuesday and Thursday, or Wednesday and Friday.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Warm up for 6 minutes before you start working out. Stretch and warm up different parts of your body before you really dive into your fitness plan. Start by walking in place for 3 minutes, then transition to a round of 60 heel digs in 1 minute. Switch to 30 knee lifts in 30 seconds, and 2 sets shoulder rolls. As a finishing touch, complete your warm-ups with 10 reps of knee bends.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-03.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 03.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-03.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-03.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Heel digs are when you kick your leg and place your heel on the ground.</li> \n    <li>Knee lifts are when you raise 1 knee and touch it with your opposite hand.</li> \n    <li>Shoulder lifts are when you roll your shoulders forwards and backwards for 10 reps in each direction.</li> \n    <li>Knee bends are when you lower your body up to and lift yourself up again.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stretch-After-Cardio\" title=\"Stretch After Cardio\">Stretch for 5 minutes</a> once you finish a workout. Don’t immediately clock out once your workout is done. Instead, take a few minutes to stretch out different parts of your body, like your hamstrings, and inner thighs. Take care of your legs with calf and thigh stretches, which help you feel loose after your workout. Try to hold each stretch for at least 10 seconds to get the maximum effect.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-04.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 04.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-04.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-04.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can stretch your hamstring by laying flat on your back and pulling your leg up so it’s perpendicular to your back.</li> \n    <li>To stretch your inner thighs, sit on the ground with your legs pointing outward and your feet touching. Then, start pulling your knees toward the ground.</li> \n    <li>Perform a slight lunge to stretch your calves.</li> \n    <li>To stretch your thighs, lie on your side and pull your foot towards your glutes. Check that your knees are touching when you do this.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Beginner Cardio Workout\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Beginner-Cardio-Workout\">Beginner Cardio Workout</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Perform 2 sets of rocket jumps. Stand in an open area with your feet spread shoulder-width apart. Bend your knees, placing your hands on your thighs, then jump up towards the ceiling with your arms lifted and extended. Repeat this exercise for 15-24 reps to really get your blood pumping. Then, do another set.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-05.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 05.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-05.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-05.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>After doing this exercise, you can recover by walking or jogging in place for at least 15 seconds.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Mix things up with 2 sets of star jumps. Bend your knees slightly and jump off the ground, moving your arms and legs outward to create a star shape with your body. Repeat this exercise for at least 15 reps and do one more set before switching to another activity.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-06.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 06.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-06.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-06.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try to keep your abs as tight as possible while you jump. Additionally, it helps to keep your back straight throughout each star jump.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Get your blood pumping with 2 sets of burpees. Start by standing up with your back straight. Quickly lower yourself into a squatting position, then quickly extend your legs backwards, creating the push-up position. Without actually doing a push-up, jump back to the original squatting position. Push off from your feet and jump into the air with your arms pointed upwards to complete the rep.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-07.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 07.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-07.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-07.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try to do at least 15 reps of burpees in each set before switching to another activity.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Walk in place as a simple workout option. Choose a place where you can move around comfortably, then start marching in place. Bend your arms at a 90-degree angle and swing them back and forth as you walk. To change things up, you can take a few steps forward or backward, or widen your stance while you walk in place. As you move, focus on keeping your abs engaged.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-08.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 08.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-08.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-08.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can do this exercise in front of the TV, if you’d like.</li> \n    <li>For a more challenging workout, pick up the speed while bringing your knees up higher as you walk.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Beginner Strength-Training Workout\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Beginner-Strength-Training-Workout\">Beginner Strength-Training Workout</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Work out your quads and glutes with a simple squat. Find an open area to exercise where you can stand comfortably without colliding with anything. Squat down and keep your back straight, bending your knees like you’re about to sit in a chair. Pause and stay in place once your glutes are a little above your knees, and knees are slightly tracking over your toes. Slowly lift yourself up and repeat the exercise for 8-10 reps.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-09.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 09.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-09.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-09.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can spread out a yoga mat to give yourself a little extra cushioning while you squat.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Focus on your back muscles with 8-10 reps of a bent-over row. Find a flat, sturdy surface that you can lean on, like a weight bench. Kneel your right knee on the table while keeping your left leg planted firmly on the ground. Bend forward so your back is parallel with the surface, and extend your lower right leg on the surface for support. At this point, hold a weight in your left hand, extending your arm down and limiting it back to your chest to finish out 1 rep.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Switch to your other arm once you’ve completed 1 set of reps.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Engage your arms and core with 10 reps of push-ups. Get into a regular push-up position with legs extended behind you and your arms separated at least shoulder-width apart. Push down, extending your elbows out as you lower your body. Immediately afterwards, push yourself back up to your original position.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Push-ups can be tricky, especially if you haven’t done any for a while. You can modify this exercise by placing your weight on your knees instead of your toes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Work your core with 10 reps of supermans. Lay face-down on the floor with both your arms and legs extended. Start by lying flat on the ground, then raise your arms, legs, head, and chest up like you’re flying through the air. Bring yourself back down to the ground slowly, and repeat the exercise again.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It may be more comfortable to do this on a yoga mat.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Following Workout Videos and Apps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Following-Workout-Videos-and-Apps\">Following Workout Videos and Apps</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Watch some videos made by personal trainers online. Search on Instagram or YouTube for videos uploaded by fitness experts. Look for content that really piques your interest, like Pilates or yoga. Follow along with these videos during your next workout.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 13 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you can search for something like “personal trainer dance workout” or “personal trainer yoga routine” to get started.</li> \n    <li>Channels like Criticalbench and Bodybuilding.com offer a lot of different workout videos.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Download fitness apps that offer guided workouts. Look online or on your phone or tablet for workout programs that you can follow, instead of doing a workout from memory. You can focus on free apps and programs, or pay a small subscription fee for certain programs, like Down Dog, Aaptiv, Peloton, or Fitbit Coach.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Nike Training Club, Nike Run Club, and C25K are all free options you can look into.</li> \n    <li>Seven, Fightcamp, TRX, and Pure Barre are other paid options you can check out.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Find workout videos on streaming services. Search sites and apps like YouTube, Hulu, and Amazon Prime for on-demand workout videos that you can follow along with. Look for programs that suit your personal fitness goals and needs. For these workouts, you’ll just need a tablet, computer, or TV that you have close by while you exercise.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Work Out at Home As a Beginner Step 15 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Services like Amazon Prime offer Zumba classes and programs like “21-Day Transformation from Gym Ra.”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>It can help to choose a specific workout goal for yourself before you get started.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>Write down your progress in a planner or notebook so you can see how far you’ve come.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>You’ll see more positive results if you follow a consistent exercise schedule.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>Invest in special equipment to take your workouts to the next level.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>You can always mix and match some of your favorite exercises while you’re strength training.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Before starting a new workout regimen, talk to your doctor about any health concerns you may have. Your doctor may be able to offer advice, suggestions, or alternatives for you.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/exercise/10-minute-home-cardio-workout/\">https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/exercise/10-minute-home-cardio-workout/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-6\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/exercise/10-minute-home-cardio-workout/\">https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/exercise/10-minute-home-cardio-workout/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-7\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.acefitness.org/education-and-resources/lifestyle/exercise-library/135/bodyweight-squat/\">https://www.acefitness.org/education-and-resources/lifestyle/exercise-library/135/bodyweight-squat/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/better/lifestyle/30-day-strength-training-routine-no-equipment-required-ncna988936\">https://www.nbcnews.com/better/lifestyle/30-day-strength-training-routine-no-equipment-required-ncna988936</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\"
