  <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.womansday.com/health-fitness/g32099846/best-workout-apps/\">https://www.womansday.com/health-fitness/g32099846/best-workout-apps/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-14\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.cnet.com/health/gym-still-closed-these-are-the-best-home-workout-options/\">https://www.cnet.com/health/gym-still-closed-these-are-the-best-home-workout-options/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/294015\">https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/294015</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-16\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/294015\">https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/294015</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-17\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/294015\">https://www.entrepreneur.com/article/294015</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-18\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.cnet.com/health/gym-still-closed-these-are-the-best-home-workout-options/\">https://www.cnet.com/health/gym-still-closed-these-are-the-best-home-workout-options/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-19\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.acefitness.org/education-and-resources/lifestyle/blog/6593/top-25-at-home-exercises/\">https://www.acefitness.org/education-and-resources/lifestyle/blog/6593/top-25-at-home-exercises/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner#_ref-20\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/fitness/in-depth/fitness/art-20048269\">https://www.mayoclinic.org/healthy-lifestyle/fitness/in-depth/fitness/art-20048269</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 22 Oct 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-01.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-01.jpg","linkMd5":"cae16a3885eb08b3cf016ef3bc162302","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn21@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-53-43-751_f7b89aab43093fc6.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":42408,"destBytes":25728,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-01.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-01.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn21@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-53-43-751_f7b89aab43093fc6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-02.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-02.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn83@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-22-292_54c35738a2b7a32e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-03.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-03.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn4@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-19-592_8428b0bfcce05ce6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-04.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-04.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn28@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-21-153_c2838b7a4db76a3a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f9/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-05.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-05.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn76@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-17-376_3c107d483ea8101e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-06.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-06.jpg":null,"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8c/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-07.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-07.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn45@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-22-628_d3cc3317602a87f7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-08.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-08.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn26@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-17-127_afc6815d86f9e0c0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-09.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-09.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn11@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-16-078_0ce07f2d4823b55b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/69/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn65@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-22-765_7b70f15b1eb320a3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/03/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn39@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-16-018_a315e773461c9e28.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn24@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-20-476_66631e2589faeb7c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn93@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-17-054_d87fc6808d38ac0d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn47@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-22-077_3a5e54c85736dde3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/84/Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid12077806-v4-728px-Work-Out-at-Home-As-a-Beginner-Step-15-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn77@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-15-945_6fcc57985d558040.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817618055},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Pay Off Credit Card Debt","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>It may seem easier to just ignore it, but your unmanaged credit card debt will haunt every step you take. It may sound like a daunting task, but you can pay off your debt with order and dignity! To attack your debt effectively, use the following strategies. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Tackling Your Debt Wisely\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tackling-Your-Debt-Wisely\">Tackling Your Debt Wisely</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Make more than the minimum payment. Credit card companies love it when you pay just enough to get by every month. At that rate, you’re mostly paying off interest and barely scratching the surface of your actual debt. Look at your most recent credit card statements to get a ballpark figure on what your monthly interest is, then budget as much of a payment as you can <i>over</i> that amount to actually see a difference in your statement.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you want to know how much above the minimum you should pay, remember what interest is. Interest is the price you pay for money, and creditors always want you to pay interest before anything else. So making the minimum payment is usually only enough to keep your interest from compounding your debt into the stratosphere—to keep it where it is, in other words. You want to try to pay enough each month to get beyond the interest and into the principal.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Pay off debt with the highest interest rate <i>first</i>. It goes almost without saying, but it's something that a lot of people forget. If one credit line is charging you 11% <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Calculate-Annual-Percentage-Rate\" title=\"Calculate Annual Percentage Rate\">Annual Percentage Rate</a>, or APR (interest over the course of a year) while another credit line is charging you 9% APR, focus all your attention on the debt that falls under 11% interest rate. Pay it off before even touching the other debt. Sure, the other one will accumulate interest in the meantime, but since you’re paying interest either way, you might as well do it at the lower percentage.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/21/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If this process seems too hard, try snowballing your debt. If your interest rates are all roughly the same or you’re simply overwhelmed by the sheer number of payments you have to make each month, make the minimum payments on all but the lowest balance––which you should attack aggressively so that it disappears quickly. Once it’s gone, add the payments you <i>would have</i> paid on the lowest debt to the minimum payment on your next-lowest debt until it, too, disappears. Repeat until all debts are cleared. The sense of satisfaction you will feel in making fewer and fewer payments each month will make the process more bearable and help you achieve your goal.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Talk to your <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Choose-Credit-Cards\" title=\"Choose Credit Cards\">credit card</a> companies. Explain your financial situation and ask if there is anything they can do to help. Many will lower your interest rate for a period of time and/or waive current late fee balances to give you an opportunity to catch up.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you've been a customer of theirs for a long time, mention that. While some credit card companies don't care about customer loyalty, more than a few do. Those that do sometimes go to great lengths to keep their customer base happy and loyal, whatever the circumstances.</li> \n    <li>If at first you don't succeed, ask someone more important. If you can't make any headway with the first persons you speak with, ask to speak to a supervisor. If that doesn't work, ask to speak to the retention department. If that doesn't work, call back in a week or two.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Come prepared. Be sure to compile a list of other offers you recieve. Know your interest rate terms. Check out the rates that competitors are offering.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Never close cards with existing balances. It might seem like an easy way to get a handle on your debt, but it'll do horrors to your credit score, and you'll still be on the hook for the debt.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup> All this will do is send your credit utilization (your available limit v. your current debt) down, further driving down your credit score. Learn more here on how to <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Improve-Your-Credit-Score\" title=\"Improve Your Credit Score\">increase your credit score</a>.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you feel like you must close an account, you need to pay it off extremely quickly, and you need to make sure that the company records that it was closed at your request and not theirs. Make this request in writing.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Move your debts around. Let's be clear, transferring money from a credit card with 12% interest to a card with 0% interest may damage your short-term credit. However, barely chipping away at your debt because your interest is too high will damage your finances in the long-term. Shop around for long-term, low- or no-percent interest rate transfer opportunities, or look into transferring some of your debt onto a low-interest card that you already have. Keep the following in mind:<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>How long the low interest rate will last. Depending on your total debt and how quickly you think you can pay it off, 0% interest for six months may not be as good a deal as 2% for 18 months.</li> \n    <li>The amount of the transfer fee. When transferring, you usually have to pay a certain percentage of your debt up-front. Make sure that a) you can afford this transfer fee and b) the fee is less than you would have paid in interest during the introductory period. Usually, transferring to a low-interest card will involve less fees than transferring to a no-interest card. Weigh how much time you expect it will take to make a dent in your debt when choosing to transfer.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>What the interest rate will be after the introductory period ends. Will it jump up to 18% after 12 months? If it does, will you have paid off enough debt by that time to make that jump worth your while?</li> \n    <li>How long you will be required to keep your balance with the company. Since credit-card hopping has become a popular way to avoid paying interest, some companies have begun stipulating that if you transfer your debt to another card before a certain amount of time has passed, the normal interest rate will be applied to all your previous balances <i>retroactively,</i> leaving you with a huge new debt.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Make sure to read all the fine print! Credit card companies are nothing if not resourceful in finding ways to take your money. Look for all the catches above <i>and more,</i> such as transfer fees and ballooning interest rates, before making any decisions.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>See what you can liquidate to lower your debt. No one likes doing it, but sometimes it needs to be done. If you just bought a car, a memory foam mattress, or a new jacuzzi, think seriously about whether you really need these items, especially if you're paying for them on installment. Liquidating your big-ticket items now will mean less financial hardship for you later on.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Always try to find the sales venue that will get you the highest resale value. Think eBay and jewelers, not pawn shops.</li> \n    <li>Get creative and do the math. For example, if you have a car payment, if you can sell your car (even for less than the note is worth) for enough to pay off a card balance or three with higher interest rates and perhaps pay off the interest on the car note, then it makes financial sense to do that.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Budgeting Your Money Like a Pro\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Budgeting-Your-Money-Like-a-Pro\">Budgeting Your Money Like a Pro</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Track your spending. It’s one thing to make mental notes of things you’ve bought over the month, but it’s another thing altogether to see them add up on paper. This is especially true if you use a credit or debit card (people tend to spend more freely if they pay with plastic) or pay for things using multiple accounts (and therefore never really see the net total). Manually tracking your expenses will not only help you make better decisions, but also identify areas in which you don’t even realize you’re overspending.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Budget-Your-Money\" title=\"Budget Your Money\">Develop a budget for yourself</a>. It isn’t enough to just throw a random payment at your credit card(s) every month. Instead, create a strategy, put it in writing, and budget your other expenses around your credit card payments. Here are some popular ways to save money and reduce your debts:\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Think seriously about starting to <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Save-All-Your-Pocket-Money-Without-Spending-It\" title=\"Save All Your Pocket Money Without Spending It\">save pocket money</a>. It sounds childish, but the savings are anything but.</li> \n    <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Apply-for-Food-Stamps-in-the-US\" title=\"Apply for Food Stamps in the US\">See if you qualify for food assistance</a>. It's not glamorous, but neither is being broke.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup></li> \n    <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Reduce-Expenses\" title=\"Reduce Expenses\">Reduce your expenses</a> by cutting costs in different areas of your life, such as spending less on entertainment or making sure your car is running efficiently so you spend less on gas.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Spend-a-Tax-Refund-Wisely\" title=\"Spend a Tax Refund Wisely\">Spend your tax refund wisely</a>. For a lot of people, a tax refund is a windfall at the beginning of the year. If you anticipate getting a tax refund this year, resolve to set a sizable chunk of it aside in order to pay off some of your debt.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Sacrifice a small luxury (or three). For example, don’t buy that coffee on the way to work every day; make one at home for a fraction of the cost. Don't buy your books, DVDs, or CDs; just borrow them from your local library. Don't buy lunches for work; just make them at your home. (Pressed for time? Even something as simple as a sandwich or a salad with a hard-boiled egg makes a great lunch. Prep it the night before if necessary.)\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-10.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>When you’re stressed, treating yourself to the little things can feel like a necessity, and to a certain extent, it is. However, there are much cheaper ways of going about this. Instead of waiting in line for an overpriced mocha, bring a thermos of tea to the park and watch the autumn leaves fall. Instead of going out to dinner with your friends next Friday night, invite them to a potluck at your place. There are plenty of creative ways to cut back without feeling like a Spartan.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Build an emergency cash fund. Credit cards are often our go-to resource for unplanned expenses (the alternator dies, you get sick and miss work, etc.), but this can undo months of payments and completely demoralize you. A better idea is to tuck some money aside strictly for emergencies.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-23\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_note-23\">[23]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-11.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This doesn’t have to be a drain on your income. Remember those expenses you are cutting back on? Instead of simply not spending, try actually setting aside the money you would have paid on one or two of those expenses (for example, bar money every Friday night, manicure money every-other Sunday, etc.). Create a (free) savings account, put it in a CD, or even hide it in a cookie jar.</li> \n    <li>Remember that this fund is for emergencies only. Break your leg? Go ahead and dip in. Want to upgrade your phone? Find the money somewhere else.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Don’t relax your spending habits because you've successfully paid off some debt. Once you start to see that credit card balance go down, you may be tempted to treat yourself to a series of restaurant outings or a shiny new smartphone. Don’t do it; a few casual purchases can put you right back where you started, especially if something unexpected happens. Keep the end goal at the forefront of your mind––rewards that cost little or nothing are much better, like seeing a movie at a friend's house or making your favorite rich chocolate dessert and eating it all!\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-12.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Keep the goal in mind. Remember what you're trying to do—get out of credit card debt. Just like smokers almost never quit by cutting back, you probably won't get out of debt if you keep adding to it by using your cards all the time. You want to try to minimize your use of cards or stop using your cards altogether.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Pay Off Credit Card Debt Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-13.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Freeze them in a block of ice if you need to. Freezing a sealed bag of water with the cards inside is a fun and mess-free way of doing this. That way, your card will be there if you need it, but you'll have to wait for the ice to thaw, giving you hours to decide whether you <i>really</i> need it.</li> \n    <li>Get a lock box. Put your cards in a lock box and put the lock box somewhere out of the way. Either give the key to someone else or put the key at another location, like your desk drawer at work, so that when you need to use the credit card, you will have to think long and hard about doing it.</li> \n    <li>As a last resort, take your cards and cut them in to pieces with scissors to make sure you won't use them again.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Use a <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-a-Credit-Card-Payoff-Calculator\" title=\"Use a Credit Card Payoff Calculator\">debt calculator</a> to help you pay off your credit and to keep track of your budget.</li> \n  <li>Consider seeing a credit counselor. A credit counselor can analyze your finances and help you come up with a workable budget and debt repayment plan.</li> \n  <li>When making any purchase stop and ask yourself these key questions: \"Do I really need to buy this?\" and \"Is there any way I can do this cheaper?\" It's worth keeping these points in mind at all time when looking to purchase things; the few coins or dollars you save can make a huge difference.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Beware of debt consolidation companies and credit counseling companies who do not provide any service other than debt consolidation. If you are considering entering into a debt consolidation plan, you may want to see a bankruptcy attorney first. He or she can analyze your debt and determine if debt consolidation is a good choice for you. An attorney can also review the debt consolidation contract and make sure that it is a legitimate company.</li> \n  <li>Credit is not the tool you think it is. Remember that credit card companies are in the business of making money. Adopting a \"Cash is king\" policy will go a long way in stopping your dependency on credit.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cancel-a-Credit-Card-Payment\" title=\"Cancel a Credit Card Payment\">Cancel a Credit Card Payment</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Choose-a-Debt-Management-Program\" title=\"Choose a Debt Management Program\">Choose a Debt Management Program</a></li> \n  <li><a class=\"mw-selflink selflink\">Pay Off Credit Card Debt</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prioritize-Your-Debts\" title=\"Prioritize Your Debts\">Prioritize Your Debts</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Budget-Your-Money\" title=\"Budget Your Money\">Budget Your Money</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Out-of-Debt-Without-Hurting-Your-Credit\" title=\"Get Out of Debt Without Hurting Your Credit\">Get Out of Debt Without Hurting Your Credit</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.nolo.com/legal-encyclopedia/how-close-credit-card-account.html\">http://www.nolo.com/legal-encyclopedia/how-close-credit-card-account.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://abcnews.go.com/Business/transfer-credit-card-balance/story?id=19581478\">http://abcnews.go.com/Business/transfer-credit-card-balance/story?id=19581478</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_ref-14\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" id=\"_note-15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_ref-15\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt#_ref-18\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"http://www.fns.usda.gov/snap/eligibility\">http://www.fns.usda.gov/snap/eligibility</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-20\"><a target=\"_blank\" </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 27 Oct 2020 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"859465fc42c3f8d0361f8617269ee798","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn30@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-13-708_9a612d5a7ae34770.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":66052,"destBytes":27316,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn30@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-13-708_9a612d5a7ae34770.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/21/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn76@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-19-917_d2454bb1ea7e5f84.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn99@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-18-840_f9d609ab9d95b332.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn57@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-16-805_2783eccdfd978602.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn34@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-18-848_910e651da34115a9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn88@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-15-994_f9522089b7a40712.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn87@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-22-326_4cb63059d1c27069.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn41@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-17-279_debb0c4df22edc64.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn48@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-15-811_106cd7dc0cb8b844.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-10.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn74@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-23-131_80c30f179a6e8c8a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b1/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-11.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn36@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-16-046_e5094c05badd560b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-12.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn83@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-19-346_dc079f15de9805f9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-13.jpg/aid33932-v4-728px-Pay-Off-Credit-Card-Debt-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn75@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-15-960_001d00591d71eeb7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817618063},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:38","title":"How to Propagate Air Plants","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Air plants, also known as Tillandsia, are unique, low maintenance plants that don’t need to develop a root system in order to grow. If you already have an air plant on hand, you can wait for it to sprout pups or offsets. You can also collect, soak, and germinate seeds to produce new plants. Whether you’re a seasoned or amateur garden, air plants can be a great addition to your home. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Propagate-Air-Plants&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Propagate-Air-Plants&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Using an Offset or Pup\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-an-Offset-or-Pup\">Using an Offset or Pup</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Watch for your air plant to develop offsets or pups. As air plants mature, they develop offsets, otherwise known as pups. Examine the bottom of your plants to see if any new offsets are growing from the main plant.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> Air plants are part of the bromeliad family, which take a notoriously long time to grow. If you’re caring for a young plant, be prepared to wait several years before seeing any offsets or pups.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-1.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some plants may have multiple pups or offsets growing from the mother plant, which is normal.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If you don't already have a mature air plant, buy one from your local gardening center or nursery.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Twist off the pup to separate it from the base plant. Wait for the offset to be a third of the size of the actual air plant. Pinch this growth with your fingers, then slowly twist it counter-clockwise. Continue rotating the plant slowly until you’ve completely pulled it off the main air plant.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-2.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t remove the pup too quickly, or you could damage the plant.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Water-Air-Plants\" title=\"Water Air Plants\">Water</a> and nourish the plant to keep it healthy. Lay the separated pup on a flat surface and tend to it like any other air plant. Spritz the independent pup with tap water on a weekly basis so the plant can continue to grow.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f5/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-3.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Move the air plant to a new place to use as a decoration. Once the plants have grown to your desired size, place them somewhere around your home as an accent. Use fishing line, liquid nails, or hot glue to display the plant, or use another method of your choice!<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/86/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-4.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Propagate-Air-Plants&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Germinating the Seeds\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Germinating-the-Seeds\">Germinating the Seeds</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Collect seeds from an existing air plant. Examine the surface of an air plant that’s currently blooming, and look for wisps of cotton along the tips of the plant. Remove these wisps and set them aside in a small bowl or container.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a2/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-5.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Soak your seeds in a bowl of water for 3-4 weeks. Fill a bowl or other container with tap water and place them somewhere you won’t forget about them. Keep an eye on the seeds over the next few weeks and wait for them to swell and grow in size. When the seeds are beginning to germinate, they’ll look slightly green and be about the size of a rice grain.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-6.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You don’t need to cover the seeds—just place them in an area where you can monitor them.</li> \n    <li>The seeds don’t need to be kept under any kind of direct sunlight while they soak, so you can leave them wherever you’d like.</li> \n    <li>You can purchase these seeds at a garden center or nursery.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Place your seeds on a piece of cheesecloth in indirect sunlight. Scoop the seeds out of the container and spread them along a piece of cheesecloth. Arrange this cloth in an area that gets a lot of indirect sunlight, like a porch or patio.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-7.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also use a soft sheet of Velcro for this.</li> \n    <li>If you keep your air plants inside, leave them near an eastern- or western-facing window.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Spritz the seeds with water on a weekly basis. Fill a spray bottle with tap water and lightly mist your growing air plants 1 time each week. You can also submerge and soak the seedlings for 20 or so minutes, then drape the plants upside-down to get rid of any extra water.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2f/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-8.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If your air plants aren’t getting enough water, they’ll start withering and curling in on themselves.</li> \n    <li>Always water your air plants in a place where they can drain easily.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Nourish the growing seedlings with a basic liquid fertilizer. Search a gardening center or nursery for liquid fertilizer that’s designed for air plants. Follow the instructions on the fertilizer bottle by using ¼ of the recommended amount of product. Pour the small amount of fertilizer into the spray bottle or bowl that you normally use to water your plants. Fertilize the plants once per month, if you desire.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/64/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-9.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You don’t have to use a fertilizer, but it could provide extra nutrients to your plants.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Transfer your plants to a new surface once they bloom. Wait for your plants to be several inches or centimeters long, or large enough to soak up water on their own.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup> Find a place in or around your home where you’d like to arrange your plants. For a natural look, you can attach your air plants to rocks, seashells, or other natural surfaces. If you’d like a more creative option, use a decorative plant stand or piece of line to show off your plants.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-10.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t display your air plant in an area with water, as this will cause long-term damage.</li> \n    <li>Air plants grow very slowly, and it may take more than 9 months for the plants to reach their full size.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Propagate-Air-Plants&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Caring for Air Plants\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Caring-for-Air-Plants\">Caring for Air Plants</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Place your air plants in any area with indirect light. Search for a place in your home with southern-facing windows. Leave your plants in an environment that’s somewhere between so they won’t wither or freeze.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/59/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-11.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you place your air plants outside, make sure that they’re not in direct sunlight.</li> \n    <li>As long as your air plants are kept in an area with indirect sunlight and a consistent temperature, you can place them wherever you want.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Mist or submerge your air plants on a weekly or regular basis. Fill a spray bottle with cool tap water and spritz the surface of your plants 2-3 times each week. If you don’t want to tend to the plant as frequently, soak it in a glass or bowl of water for 30 minutes. You only need to soak your plants once every week or so.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-12.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Add a small amount of liquid fertilizer to your plants on a monthly basis. Read the instructions on a package of basic liquid fertilizer and pour out ¼ of the recommended amount. Mix the product into a bowl or spray bottle filled with water, then spritz or soak the plants as you normally would. Only use fertilizer once a month, as it isn’t essential to your air plants’ health.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Propagate Air Plants Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-13.jpg/aid11719527-v4-728px-Propagate-Air-Plants-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Propagate-Air-Plants&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Air plants only bloom once before withering away, so be sure to have plenty of seeds on hand.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Propagate-Air-Plants#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Propagate-Air-Plants&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Things You’ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You’ll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.E2.80.99ll-Need\">Things You’ll Need</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Propagate-Air-Plants&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Using an Offset or Pup\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Using-an-Offset-or-Pup_2\">Using an Offset or Pup</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Water</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Propagate-Air-Plants&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Germinating the Seeds\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Germinating-the-Seeds_2\">Germinating the Seeds</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Bowl or container</li> \n  <li>Air plant seeds</li> \n  <li>Cheesecloth</li> \n  <li>Water</li> \n  <li>Spray bottle</li> \n  <li>Liquid fertilizer</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Propagate-Air-Plants&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Caring for Air Plants\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Caring-for-Air-Plants_2\">Caring for Air Plants</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Water</li> \n  <li>Spray bottle</li> \n  <li>Bowl</li> \n  <li>Liquid fertilizer</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a
